intro: Mezzettia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered mezzettia, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
